title: Head of Technology, Founder's Studio
description: WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world’s best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently #1 ranked consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list and have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor’s list for the last 13 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents. WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH Founder’s Studio, Bain’s corporate venture studio, identifies, builds and scales the best new business ideas from both inside and outside of the firm. Founder’s Studio focuses on turning professional services methodology and client needs into software product that can constitute attractive businesses. The Founder’s Studio will support typically 4-6 ventures simultaneously to develop their ideas targeting to spin-off 2-3 of them any given year. Each venture will be incubated for a period of ~6 months before being potentially spun out from Bain or “folding” (in the “fold” case all the know-how created in the incubation period needs to be available for the Founder’s Studio and for the Practices involved). The key stages of the Founder’s Studio are: • Pre-Incubation (idea selection and ideas validation) • Incubation o Concept o Prototype o MVP o Spin-out (Series Seed funding round) o Growth o External funding (Series A funding round) WHERE YOU’LL FIT WITHIN THE TEAM This is a hands-on full-stack development role . The Head of Technology will lead a team of engineers (both in-house and from services vendors) comprising Founder’s Studio’s engineering group. You are an established full-stack engineer lead who is ready for the challenge of leading a team of in-house and externally contracted engineers to deliver cutting edge next generation products in an entrepreneurial environment. WHAT YOU’LL DO Lead a team of 5-20 internal and external engineers (UI, Data Engineering, Machine Learning and Backend). Lead recruiting, hiring, onboarding, staffing, and professional development for the engineering team (with support from Engine 2 Recruiting and HR teams). Work closely with Founder’s Studio Partner and Head of Studio to inform and participate in important decisions about the Founder’s Studio portfolio, such as venture selection, persevere/pivot/perish, and key personnel decisions. Co-ordinate and manage external vendors providing technical services, including ensuring high quality and productive work product Set high standards in the software development, build and deployment processes on AWS infrastructure Be ready to roll up your sleeves to architect business applications leveraging the latest architectural paradigms. Build a culture where you lead by example with your technology expertise solving challenging software development problems. Work with the engineering teams to develop customer facing applications, predictive models, data services & platform services Co-ordinate real-time troubleshooting and operational response to incidents and outages and keeping tabs on post-release metrics Supervise and coach on all aspects of software & Infrastructure engineering project roadmaps, resource allocation, and execution Be the expert on how to best use Micro Services based architecture, cloud technologies, deal with large scales datasets and apply appropriate ML tools and platforms. Be a topic expert on database technologies, data management platforms to design, build, operate & scale our next-generation products Co-ordinate and facilitate communication between our in-house and external application, machine learning and infrastructure teams Essential Functions 25% Vendor and engineering team management and recruiting 35% Design, design review, build/debug devops tooling, data engineering  pipelines, troubleshoot cloud infrastructure 20% Sprint process and planning 20% Code review and feedback ABOUT YOU Education Required : Bachelors in Computer Science Preferred: Masters in Computer Science or related fields Experience Required: 10+ years in the software development/engineering roles with a minimum of 3+ years of leading and managing engineering teams. Experience with providing technical vision, driving strategy and successfully executing across proprietary and open source technologies Have a background in modern software development, familiar with current standards and cloud based, developer tools sets for CI/CD in delivering a comprehensive SDLC such as GitHub, GitOps, Jenkins, Docker Experience delivering large-scale secure, stable, scalable, and observable cloud based micro service based solutions In-depth, hands-on knowledge of Python Experience with ETL pipelines Experience utilizing big data and machine learning technologies (e.g. H2O, Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra). Experience with workflow management platforms like Airflow Experience with distributed systems and backend service development Experience working with services vendors Natively holds a "bias for action", is results oriented, data driven having the ability to shape and influence decisions Excellent written and verbal communication skills  with the ability to represent and advocate complex technical concepts Excellent ability to work collaboratively with distributed cross-functional teams Comfortable in a less structured, fast paced entrepreneurial environment Familiarity with machine learning techniques and natural language processing (e.g. featurization, n-gram analysis, supervised classification and unsupervised topic clustering, etc) Experience with building out cloud infrastructure or using AWS services (e.g. Sagemaker, Infra tools, etc) Knowledge and Skills Required Cloud native technology background Must have shipped SaaS software Preferred Experience in a startup as an entrepreneur or an early employee as an engineering lead/manag er new ventures
summary: Bain & Company's Founder's Studio seeks a Head of Technology to lead a team of engineers in developing and scaling new business ideas. This is a hands-on, full-stack development role requiring 10+ years of experience and a strong background in modern software development, cloud technologies, and machine learning. The ideal candidate will have experience leading engineering teams, building SaaS software, and working in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.

title: Sr. Technical Director
description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! Job Description As a key Technical Lead for RF/Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer, you will play a lead role in the development of next generation RF circuits for optical communications. We are actively seeking talented RF IC design engineers who want to join a dynamic and experienced team and take their technical knowledge to the next level in our mission of excellence. Does this sound exciting? If so, apply today! Your Role You will be working with talented skilled team to develop the next generation circuits to solve the bandwidth problems in AI/ML applications. This is a small team environment in a great location that is very collaborative with close personal interactions. The selected individual will work with a highly qualified team of engineers, located both locally and abroad. Requirements Strong Technical Leader with execution track record. Must have a proven track record RF IC design in SiGe or CMOS technologies and have experience in developing full Driver or TIA circuits supporting volume production. PhD or MS in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent) preferred. Ideal candidates will have at least 7 years of experience of SiGe, CMOS RF, Mixed-signal and Analog design experience. Ability to take the specifications and generate a circuit architecture for either Driver or TIA design. Be a lead for the Driver or TIA circuit, and participation the stages with clear specs to work with other engineers. Through knowledge of Cadence RF simulation and Layout tools, and hands on experience with layout and its impact in the performance of these circuits. Good knowledge of PDK, and its impact on Monte-Carlo simulations, and performance metrics. Mentoring junior engineers and working with global engineers is critical for this job. In addition to TIA and Driver design, ideal candidate will have expertise in the following areas: RF circuits for optical and/or wireless communications Low-Noise amplifiers (LNA), Variable gain amplifiers (VGA) Common circuits such as Band-gap reference, PLL, clocking, ESD etc Good knowledge of Signal Integrity and associated compensation circuits. Microwave or RF engineering, specifically transmission lines theory, matching, RF device models. System-level specification, floor planning, characterization, and productization experience is desired. Experience with system level design tools (e.g. Matlab, Verilog-AMS, etc.) is plus. Inclusivity at the Heart of Our Values Lumentum wholeheartedly embraces applications from individuals with disabilities, offering accommodations upon request to ensure that all candidates participate fully in every stage of our selection process. As a globally reaching, culturally diverse company driven by innovation, we are cultivating a culture of diversity and inclusivity where individual distinctions are celebrated. We stand united in our unwavering commitment to embody our Guiding Principles: Innovate, Engage, Deliver, Excel, and Win. It is our belief that our differences collectively fortify us, fuel our creativity, and enhance our ability to deliver exceptional outcomes. At Lumentum, we understand that our people are the driving force behind our success. Pay Range P95-USA-1 :$174,300.00 - $249,000.00 Disclaimer Final base salary for the successful candidate will depend on multiple factors, including but not limited to, job location, where work will be performed, qualifications, work history and relevant experience. With our continual goal of making Lumentum a best place to work for our employees, we strive to offer employees competitive total compensation packages, which may include annual bonus, commission for certain sales roles, equity, and health and welfare benefits.
summary: Lumentum is seeking a Technical Lead RF/Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer to develop next-generation RF circuits for optical communications. This role involves leading a team in developing circuits for AI/ML applications, working with both local and international engineers, and mentoring junior engineers. Ideal candidates have 7+ years of experience in SiGe or CMOS RF, Mixed-signal and Analog design, expertise in Driver or TIA circuit design, knowledge of Cadence RF simulation and Layout tools, and experience in areas like RF circuits for optical and wireless communications, low-noise amplifiers, variable gain amplifiers, common circuits, signal integrity, microwave or RF engineering, system-level design, and floor planning.

title: Hybrid Business Data Analyst 29795
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Solving IT International Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today! A global leader in the retail pharmacy and wellness market is focused on offering their customers groundbreaking solutions to expand offerings and become the health and well-being partner of choice. &#; This Contract role as a Hybrid Business Data Analyst in Deerfield, IL will be responsible for the performance of the overall quality speech analytics category design. They work cross-functionally with various groups internally and externally, collaborates and synthesizes analyses for the implementation of scorecards. Responsible for extrapolating data, developing queries, ensuring standardization of external files, leading projects that relate directly to the speech analytic platform, and make recommendations for the betterment of the company. Works hand-in-hand with other analysts and specialists within the team to build and invent an outstanding product with a prime focus on accuracy, understandability and performance of the product. &#; &#; Responsibilities: &#; Implement statistical language models, computational frameworks to process massive volumes of data, and engineer prototypes in a programming language (examples: Python, Java, R). Analytical and knowledgeable, recognize pertinent language patterns and conversational content that lead to business value Analyze recorded audio and audio-based data sets for critical insights. Captures combinations of keywords phrases within the system for optimal configurations performance Natural Language Processing: Develop and/or apply statistical modeling techniques, optimization methods, and other ML techniques to different applications. Participate in design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models and analytical solutions for natural language applications. Responsible for determining opportunities through analysis of current or future trends and provide ongoing speech category design Determine what call events (keywords and phrases) to train the software to recognize as structured data to support analytics and business goals, by using an inquisitive and intuitive approach Weekly/monthly reporting to management and business units Familiarity with Voice User Interface (VUI) documents Use a variety of testing methods to measure the impact of ongoing campaigns and new initiatives. Build positive relationships, cultivate decisions and communicate findings to executives and partners. &#; Requirements: &#; Bachelor s in computer science, OR High School diploma/GED plus three years of equivalent experience Programming experience in one or more of the following: Java, C++, Python or equivalent. Experience managing large datasets, both structured and unstructured Experience collaborating with internal and external resources to develop strategies that meet department goals. Experience in identifying operational issues, recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. Experience developing ways of accomplishing goals with little or no supervision, depending on oneself to complete objectives and determining when escalation of issues is necessary. Programming Languages: Python, R, Spark, SQL PowerBi &#; Benefits:&#; &#; Solving IT, a Woman and LGBTQ+ owned and operated organization is thrilled to provide a comprehensive benefit package to all our W2 employees and their families, regardless of gender. We are proud to offer five diverse health plan options as well as a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&D Insurance, and a 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT covers a portion of the health and dental premiums for our employees.&#; &#; As you progress in your professional journey, Solving IT is dedicated to accommodating your evolving preferences and matching you with fulfilling projects. We champion equality and embrace diversity in all its forms. Creating an atmosphere that encourages varied perspectives to collaborate fosters personal development, strengthens team unity, and contributes to the overall success of the organization!&#; &#; Whether you're seeking your next career challenge or aiming to stay abreast of industry trends, Solving IT is committed to supporting your career advancement. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds and utilize the most up-to-date market insights and compensation data to ensure that you receive not just advice, but the complete Solving IT Experience.&#; Hybrid Business Data Analyst 29795
summary: A global leader in retail pharmacy and wellness is seeking a Hybrid Business Data Analyst to design and implement speech analytics solutions. Responsibilities include statistical modeling, NLP, data analysis, and project management. The ideal candidate will have experience with programming languages like Python, Java, and R, as well as knowledge of PowerBI and data management.  The role requires a Bachelor's in computer science or equivalent experience. This is a contract position located in Deerfield, IL.

title: Senior Principal or Principal Director, Legal and CLM Reinvention
description: Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent- and innovation-led company with approximately 742,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and AI with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients reinvent and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com. In Strategy & Consulting we work with C-suite executives, leaders and boards of the world’s leading organizations, helping them reinvent every part of their enterprise to drive greater growth, enhance competitiveness, implement operational improvements, reduce cost, deliver sustainable 360° stakeholder value, and set a new performance frontier for themselves and the industry in which they operate. Our deep industry and functional expertise is supported by proprietary assets and solutions that help organizations transform faster and become more resilient. Underpinned by technology, data, analytics, AI, change management, talent and sustainability capabilities, our Strategy & Consulting services help architect and accelerate all aspects of an organization’s total enterprise reinvention. About Accenture: In Accenture Legal and CLM Reinvention, our mission is to help our clients re-engineer Legal and Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) delivery across their enterprise, leveraging Accenture’s expertise and market-leading capabilities in scaled process design, change management, technology, data and AI/ML, as well as our global managed services. Our Legal and CLM professionals sit in our Strategy & Consulting business, designing and implementing complex transformation projects that integrate strategy, people, technology, digital and AI/ML to enable end-to-end op model and value-driven reinvention for clients. We focus on enabling world class outcomes for our clients’ corporate legal departments, CLOs, Legal Ops teams as well as business or functional buyers wishing to transform their CLM capabilities, such as Chief Procurement Officers, Chief Revenue Officers and CIOs. The Work This is a unique opportunity for an experienced and ambitious consultant to join our global team and help to shape the future of our offerings as we expand our footprint in the dynamic sectors of legal and CLM transformation. We are looking for a senior individual with demonstrated consulting experience in the fields of Legal transformation, Legal Ops and/or CLM process/functional transformation. You Are Individuals in this role will have prior experience with: Legal and/or CLM operating model assessment, design and transformation execution Identifying opportunities for clients to improve and transform their operating models, synthesizing assessment data, prioritizing focus areas and holding value-based conversations with senior client stakeholders Solutioning transformation and Legal and/or CLM managed services projects Selecting, implementing, and optimizing Enterprise Legal Management platforms (e.g. TeamConnect, Onit, Passport, Brightflag) Automation of Legal and/or CLM workflows Legal and/or CLM technology strategy End-to-End Legal and/or CLM capabilities and processes Familiarity with common CLM tech platforms A professional at this position level within Accenture has these responsibilities: Lead and manage the delivery of projects through all phases based on Accenture’s cost and financial metrics, including client interactions, key stakeholders, PMO, and onshore/offshore resources to ensure the project is delivered to the quality, budget, and timeline expectations. Contribute to strategy and planning for the fast-growing Legal and CLM Reinvention business Identify, progress and close new business development opportunities by building both internal and external network of professionals Lead and prepare responses to request for proposals, including interaction with prospective clients to understand the opportunities and provide solutions to meet client requests. Prepare business case, solution options, project plans, estimates, staffing requirements and execution approach and use them as part of proposal to the client. Demonstrate though-leadership across areas of Legal and CLM transformation. Interact with senior management at a client and/or within Accenture on various matters. When addressing complex scenarios, can articulate alternate options and get acceptance of the alternative approach. Supervise and mentor our talent across the practice area Basic Qualifications: Minimum of 8 years of experience in Legal/Legal Ops consulting and/or CLM consulting at a recognized consulting firm or ALSP Minimum of 8 years of experience in ELM solution implementation Leader on a minimum of 3 complex Legal and/or CLM transformation projects for major corporations through entire project lifecycle Experience selecting, implementing and optimizing LegalTech Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university/college Preferred Qualifications: MBA or master’s degree from an accredited business or graduate school Project Management Professional (PMP) Lean Six Sigma Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP) Knowledge in technologies such as Gen AI tools, RPAs, BI platforms. Travel in this position will range from 0-100%. Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Maryland, New York or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply. Information on benefits is here. The role involves leading and managing projects, contributing to business strategy, identifying business development opportunities, and demonstrating thought leadership in legal and CLM transformation. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience in Legal/Legal Ops consulting and/or CLM consulting at a recognized consulting firm or ALSP, 8 years of experience in ELM solution implementation, and leadership on at least 3 complex Legal and/or CLM transformation projects for major corporations.

title: Intern - UIRP
description: Work Mode: Hybrid Location: Hybrid at Champaign, IL Must be currently enrolled at University of Illinois-Urbana Champaign Opportunity The Automated Inspection Systems Engineer will work on the development and implementation of automated inspection systems across Kohler's manufacturing processes. This individual will address the challenges posed by manual inspection processes, inconsistent results, and the need for improved defect tracking and classification. The engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that the inspection systems meet Kohler's high-quality standards and enhance the efficiency of the inspection process. Specific Responsibilities Develop Automated Inspection Systems: Design, development, and deployment of automated inspection systems that leverage machine learning algorithms to enhance speed, accuracy, and consistency compared to manual inspections. Consolidate Defect Library: Create a consolidated defect library across Kohler's Kitchen & Bath (K&B) processes to standardize defect classification and improve data tracking. Improve Consistency and Efficiency: Implement systems to improve the consistency of inspection processes and reallocate inspection personnel to value-added activities. Sensor Integration and Optimization: Work on developing a flexible AI vision inspection model capable of combining inputs from various sensor types and devices to process and classify all defects within Kohler’s manufacturing process requirements. SOP Development: Develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) for adding and teaching new products into the automated inspection systems. Validation and Testing: Validate and test the automated inspection systems to ensure they meet or exceed required cycle times and can detect all defects for a given product category. Skills/Requirements Experience in developing automated inspection systems and integrating machine learning algorithms. Proficiency in sensor integration and optimization. Strong project management skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines. Knowledge of industrial manufacturing processes and quality assurance standards. Familiarity with AI/ML technologies and their application in industrial settings. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Tech Stack Machine learning algorithms Sensor integration AI vision inspection models Python, C++, MATLAB, OpenCV Industrial automation tools Vision and/or audio systems, AI & Infrared cameras, Preferred Current enrollment Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Master’s degree preferred. Experience in developing automated inspection systems in an industrial manufacturing environment. Proficiency in Python, C++, or MATLAB, OpenCV Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and their application in automated inspection systems. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Deliverables The Automated Inspection Systems Engineer will deliver a flexible AI vision inspection model capable of combining inputs from various sensor types to process and classify all defects within Kohler’s manufacturing process requirements for quality, cycle time, and accuracy. Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future. Why Choose Kohler? We empower each associate to #BecomeMoreAtKohler with a competitive total rewards package to support your health and wellbeing, access to career growth and development opportunities, a diverse and inclusive workplace, and a strong culture of innovation. With more than 30,000 bold leaders across the globe, we’re driving meaningful change in our mission to help people live gracious, healthy, and sustainable lives. About Us It is Kohler’s policy to recruit, hire, and promote qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability or status as a protected veteran. If, as an individual with a disability, you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact kohlerjobs@kohler.com . Kohler Co. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
summary: The Automated Inspection Systems Engineer at Kohler will develop and implement automated inspection systems across their manufacturing processes. This role focuses on using machine learning to improve speed, accuracy, and consistency of inspections, standardizing defect classification, and optimizing sensor integration for a flexible AI vision inspection model.

title: AI/ML Engineer
description: We're seeking exceptional engineers to drive our ambitious goals forward! We need individuals with extraordinary skills who can thrive in our fast-paced environment and deliver consistently outstanding results. Requirements In this role, you will: Elevate our retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) capabilities by ensuring efficient integration and utilization of diverse data sources Focus on enhancing embedding generation techniques, optimizing them for both accuracy and efficiency Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI models, understanding their evolving capabilities and complexities of integration. You'll become the team's go-to expert, assisting end-users in selecting the most suitable models for their use cases Collaborate closely with both backend and frontend teams to seamlessly integrate AI models into our products and services Prioritize customer needs and build strong relationships by actively engaging in customer support alongside other team members You'll excel in this role if you have: A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, or related fields Demonstrated expertise in machine learning and AI, particularly in generative models Proficiency in implementing retrieval-augmented generation pipelines Strong programming skills in Python and hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch Familiarity with embedding techniques and their practical applications in AI models Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a track record of thriving in fast-paced environments Excellent communication and collaboration skills You'll stand out if you also possess: A PhD in a relevant field, showcasing your advanced expertise Published research or projects in generative AI, embeddings, or retrieval-augmented generation Experience with deploying large-scale ML models in production environments Contributions to open-source AI/ML projects, highlighting your proactive involvement in the title: ML Engineer
description: Our client is developing ground-breaking weather forecasting technology with the aim of providing fast and accurate climate data. Their aim is to significantly outperform current weather forecasting and become a huge business. Founders have extensive experience in building fast-growing successful companies. Some famous examples are: - [OneSoil](https://onesoil.ai/en/) - [MAPS.ME](https://maps.me), acquired [by mail.ru in 2014](https://techcrunch.com/2014/11/13/mail-ru-buys-maps-me-to-integrate-crowdsourced-maps-into-its-my-co...) (maker of navigation apps with the offline mode) - [AIMATTER](https://www.aimatter.com), acquired [by Google in 2017](https://techcrunch.com/2017/08/16/google-acquires-aimatter-maker-of-the-fabby-computer-vision-app/) (maker of the Fabby Computer Vision app) - MapData, acquired [by Mapbox in 2017](https://techcrunch.com/2017/11/03/mapbox-acquires-mapdata-to-help-it-expand-into-ar-maps/) (AI and AR-based navigation) - [VOCHI](https://vochi.com), acquired [by Pinterest in 2021](https://techcrunch.com/2021/12/06/pinterest-invests-in-creator-tools-with-acquisition-of-video-creat...) (a video creation and editing app) Given that they’re pushing the limits and building a new approach to predict the weather along with a new way of consuming weather predictions What you'll do Develop ML models for weather forecasting Improve model performance Required Deep knowledge of convolutional neural networks; Basic understanding of recurrent neural networks (LSTM, GRU, Transformers) and time series analysis; Hands-on experience with modern frameworks - PyTorch, TensorFlow; Experience in the delivery of production-ready ML solutions; Basic knowledge of statistics; Ability and openness to learn, fail, reflect, and apply learning moving forward; Would be nice to have Experience working with satellite imagery; Experience working with RADAR/LiDAR data (or any other sparse types of data); Experience working with map data. What they offer Competitive skill- and experience-based compensation, annual review with raise option; Stock options for their employees; Awesome team, friendly and professional; Work equipment that you choose; Paid Time Off; Comfortable office in the heart of Warsaw.
summary: Develop ML models for weather forecasting and improve model performance using convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, and time series analysis. Implement production-ready ML solutions within a fast-growing startup with experience building successful companies. The ideal candidate has experience working with satellite imagery, RADAR/LiDAR data, and map data.

title: Deep Learning Performance Engineer
description: About Anyscale: At Anyscale , we're on a mission to democratize distributed computing and make it accessible to software developers of all skill levels. ML Systems knowledge Experience training deep learning models Contributions to deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow) Contributions to deep learning compilers (Triton, TVM, MLIR) Experience using Ray Compensation At Anyscale, we take a market-based approach to compensation. This role is also eligible to participate in Anyscale's Equity and Benefits offerings, including the following: Stock Options Healthcare plans, with premiums covered by Anyscale at 99% 401k Retirement Plan Wellness stipend Education stipend Paid Parental Leave Flexible Time Off Commute reimbursement 100% of in-office meals covered Anyscale Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are evaluated without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law. Anyscale Inc. is an E-Verify company and you may review the Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Right to Work posters in English and Spanish

The role involves working with product and research teams to implement optimizations for Anyscale's platform, Endpoints, and open-source offerings, keeping up with the latest advancements in the field, and potentially contributing to deep learning frameworks and compilers.

title: ML Engineer
description: Who we are? Typeface is on a mission to help everyone express their unique imagination. We believe technology is a creative partner that empowers any company to tell their unique stories faster and easier than ever before. Generative AI platforms represent a major breakthrough to create content at tremendous speed and scale. For enterprises to successfully leverage their potential, they need to include their unique voice and style and ensure responsible AI practices. We unite content velocity with brand personalization and safety, so that every company can achieve its creative potential. We are looking for passionate individuals who want to help build a fast-growing GenAI company from the ground up. Why join us? Bleeding edge technology: We explore uncharted territory at the intersection of art and science. We strive to revolutionize content, amplifying human creativity with cutting-edge AI in a safe and responsible way. Best-in-class product: We built the leading enterprise-grade generative AI solution, so any business, from startups to Fortune 500 companies, can 10x personalized content at scale. Typeface combines the best-in-class AI platforms across the board with our own brand-personalized AI model to hyper-personalize content at scale with a responsible AI approach. World-class team: Founded by the former CPO & CTO of Adobe, Abhay Parasnis, and a highly experienced team with a proven track record of building revolutionary, long-lasting AI, SaaS, and media technologists that are completely focused on customer impact. Top-tier Investors: Backed by top-tier venture capital firms: Lightspeed Venture Partners, Salesforce Ventures, GV (Google Ventures), Madrona, Menlo Ventures, and M12 (Microsoft’s Venture Fund). Check out our Series B announcement. Rapid customer traction: Overwhelming demand from Fortune 500 companies and popular digital-native brands from every industry. Awards & recognition: Honored to be a winner of 10+ industry awards for our unique approach to enterprise GenAI, including Fast Company’s “Top 5 Next Big Things in Tech” and Adweek’s AI Company of the Year. The Mission: As an Machine Learning Engineer , you will be responsible for building machine learning models/systems and innovative web applications that deliver the power of Generative AI to our customers. You will work closely with designers, product managers and other engineers driving the technical designs and implementations. Core Responsibilities: We are looking for strong Machine Learning engineers across multiple levels to join our team and help us build innovative Generative AI solutions that deliver the power of Generative AI to our customers. You will be responsible for: Define the roadmap for generation of various content types including text, image, audio and video enabling us to generate brand-affinitized, hyper-personalized, and safe content Own the delivery of key business, product and technology initiatives across design, specification, development, testing, and launch. Establish and implement processes for model training, fine-tuning, testing, and operating the Generative AI models at significant scale. Investigate, prototype and deliver innovative solutions Collaborate with other engineers, Product and Business Teams to identify new ways to improve our product and drive growth Establish a data-driven development culture by driving the definition, tracking, and operationalizing of feature, product, and company-level metrics Minimum Qualifications: Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or a related field Experience with building and evolving ML Training and Inferencing systems at significant scale with a purpose of solving real-world problems. 2+ years of prior experience designing, building and scaling systems for training, testing, and running Machine Learning models at scale Have a track records of coming up with new ideas or improving upon existing ideas in machine learning, demonstrated by accomplishments such as first author publications or projects Proficiency in Python, C/C++ (or equivalent) Ability to create self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and passionate about prototyping Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience with AzureML, GCP Vertex, AWS Sagemaker or similar platforms Hands-on experience in deploying and tuning Generative AI models in cloud or on local system is a plus Experience working at a high-growth startup or tech company Publications and research experiences in ML venues and/or vision/language applications are a plus Benefits Competitive salaries and equity Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision) Opportunities for professional growth and development Equality Opportunity Statement Typeface is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. * Diversity & Inclusion Statement At Typeface, we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential to our success. We are committed to creating a workplace that is welcoming and inclusive for all employees, regardless of their background or identity. We value diversity in all its forms and strive to create a culture of respect, understanding, and collaboration.
summary: Typeface is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to build and evolve ML systems for generating various content types (text, image, audio, video) at scale. The ideal candidate has a Master's or PhD in Computer Science, 2+ years of experience with ML training and inferencing systems, a proven track record of innovation, proficiency in Python and C/C++, and experience with cloud platforms like AzureML, GCP Vertex, or AWS Sagemaker.

title: AI ML Cloud Engineer

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in deploying and managing AI/ML solutions while adhering to enterprise security standards. Additionally, familiarity with GenAI architecture and other cloud providers' AI/ML offerings is highly desirable. Ensure scalability, availability, and reliability of AI/ML solutions through robust architecture and infrastructure design. Implement multi-region deployments to optimize performance and redundancy. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement infrastructure for GenAI architecture principles, including RAG, LLM's, and data pipelines. Implement and maintain service reliability engineering (SRE) practices to enhance system resilience and availability. Stay up to date with the latest advancements in cloud technologies, AI/ML algorithms, and security best practices. Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and address technical concerns. Provide basic samples to the teams on using the provisioned services. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field. Proven experience as a Cloud Engineer or similar role, with a focus on AI/ML solutions. Strong proficiency in provisioning and automating cloud infrastructure/platforms especially AI resources on the Azure platform. Experience with IAAS, PAAS, and SAAS enablement on the Azure platform. Experience with GenAI architecture principles, including RAG, LLM's, and data pipelines. Solid understanding of data safety and security standards implementation. Familiarity with other cloud providers' AI/ML offerings is an added advantage. Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment. Analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail. Thanks & Regards Utsav Manager ChabezTech LLC 4 Lemoyne Dr #102, Lemoyne, PA 17043, USA Email: utsav@chabeztech.com | www.chabeztech.c
summary: Senior Cloud Engineer with expertise in provisioning AI resources on Azure (or GCP) to deploy and manage AI/ML solutions, ensuring scalability, availability, and reliability. Requires experience with GenAI architecture, IAAS, PAAS, SAAS, and data pipelines, along with strong communication and collaboration skills.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Senior ML Engineer Position – San Francisco (Hybrid/Flexible) Introduction: We are seeking a talented Senior ML Engineer to join our team and lead pioneering projects in data-centric AI. This role offers the chance to develop cutting-edge tools that diagnose and correct dataset issues, enhancing the reliability and performance of AI models across various industries. About the Company: Our company, a MIT/ Berkeley spinout, has quickly emerged as a significant player in AI technology. We develop advanced data-centric AI solutions, including no-code SaaS enterprise solutions that help identify and rectify dataset issues. Our founders bring a wealth of experience from top organizations, and our mission is to streamline the way AI systems interact with real-world, messy data. This position involves handling text, image, and structured data from diverse industry sectors and developing scalable modeling infrastructures. Candidates should be well-versed in software engineering, MLOps, and contemporary AI technologies, including Generative AI and Foundation models. Annual travel stipend to support work-from-anywhere flexibility and cultural enrichment. Stipend for attending relevant conferences to stay abreast of industry advancements. Opportunity to work with a team of AI pioneers and industry leaders in a well-funded startup environment. Key Responsibilities: Develop and manage cloud infrastructure for ML projects involving diverse datasets. Lead and execute full-cycle Data/AI projects from inception through to production. Act as a technical lead within the ML team, promoting innovation in algorithmic approaches to enhance dataset quality. Maintain and enhance production code and models in cloud-based environments. This position is designed for an individual ready to challenge their skills and lead innovative projects that refine the utility and accuracy of machine learning data. Join us in our quest to advance AI technology and achieve our mission of enhancing data quality at a fundamental level. Relevant Keywords Senior ML Engineer, data-centric AI, MLOps, cloud infrastructure, Generative AI, Foundation models, data quality, scalable modeling infrastructure, machine learning, SaaS, Python, AWS, GCP, Software Development.

Work with text, image, and structured data from various industries, build scalable modeling infrastructures, and lead full-cycle Data/AI projects.  Strong software engineering, MLOps, and contemporary AI technologies expertise required.

title: ML Operations Engineer (MLOps)
description: Company Overview: Welcome to the forefront of machine learning operations! At our company, we're driving the next wave of AI revolution through cutting-edge ML operations technologies. Our mission is to develop scalable and reliable ML systems that empower businesses and revolutionize industries. Join us and be part of a dynamic team committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible with MLOps. Position Overview: As an ML Operations Engineer (MLOps), you'll play a critical role in developing and maintaining scalable and reliable machine learning pipelines and systems. Working closely with data scientists, software engineers, and DevOps specialists, you'll ensure the smooth deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models in production environments. If you're passionate about bridging the gap between data science and operations and eager to drive innovation in ML infrastructure, we want you on our team. Requirements Key Responsibilities: ML Pipeline Development: Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end ML pipelines for model training, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring, leveraging best practices in MLOps Model Deployment: Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance, and automating deployment processes using CI/CD pipelines Model Monitoring: Implement monitoring and alerting systems to track model performance, data drift, and model drift, and take proactive measures to maintain model health and accuracy Infrastructure Management: Manage cloud-based infrastructure and resources for machine learning workloads, optimizing for cost, performance, and scalability Version Control: Implement version control and model versioning systems to track changes to models and ensure reproducibility and traceability Collaboration and Documentation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements, prioritize tasks, and deliver solutions that meet business objectives, and document processes and workflows for knowledge sharing and onboarding Security and Compliance: Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations in ML systems and workflows Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field Strong background in machine learning operations (MLOps) or DevOps, with hands-on experience in deploying and managing machine learning models in production environments Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Go, and experience with ML frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and proficiency in using relevant tools and services for ML infrastructure management, such as Kubernetes, Docker, or Apache Airflow Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (e.g., Git), and infrastructure as code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform) Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking, with a keen attention to detail and a passion for tackling complex technical challenges Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Benefits Competitive salary: The industry standard salary for ML Operations Engineers (MLOps) typically ranges from $150,000 to $230,000 per year, depending on experience and qualifications. Exceptional candidates may be eligible for higher compensation packages Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans Flexible work hours and remote work options Generous vacation and paid time off Professional development opportunities, including access to training programs, conferences, and workshops State-of-the-art technology environment with access to cutting-edge ML tools and resources Vibrant and inclusive company culture with team-building activities and social events Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company Exciting projects with real-world impact across diverse industries Chance to work alongside top talent and industry experts in the field of ML operations Join Us: Ready to shape the future of ML operations? Apply now to join our team and be part of an exciting journey of innovation and growth!
summary: We are looking for an ML Operations Engineer (MLOps) to develop and maintain scalable and reliable machine learning pipelines and systems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and DevOps specialists to ensure the smooth deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models in production environments. We need someone passionate about bridging the gap between data science and operations and eager to drive innovation in ML infrastructure.

title: Software Engineer (ML Platform)
description: About Anyscale: At Anyscale , we're on a mission to democratize distributed computing and make it accessible to software developers of all skill levels. We’re commercializing Ray , a popular open-source project that's creating an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Companies like OpenAI , Uber , Spotify , Instacart , Cruise , and many more, have Ray in their tech stacks to accelerate the progress of AI applications out into the real world. With Anyscale, we’re building the best place to run Ray, so that any developer or data scientist can scale an ML application from their laptop to the cluster without needing to be a distributed systems expert. Proud to be backed by Andreessen Horowitz, NEA, and Addition with $250+ million raised to date. Anyscale is based in San Francisco, CA. Employees are required to come in office 3x a week. Anyscale is actively seeking talented engineers to join our team and contribute to the development of next-generation, high-performance machine learning serving systems. We value diversity and inclusion, and we encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply. Many existing ML serving tools are inherited from previous infrastructure generations, but emerging ML applications present new requirements, such as high compute demands, specialized hardware needs, and the integration of multiple models and business logic within a single request. At Anyscale, our mission is to provide a powerful yet simple set of tools that enable the seamless deployment of complex ML applications in production. About the Platform Team: The Platform team is dedicated to creating world-class systems for serving ML models in production. This includes building and maintaining the open-source Ray Serve library and contributing directly to the Anyscale platform used by our customers for critical applications. Our work is often user-facing, allowing you to collaborate with open-source users and customers ranging from lean ML engineering teams at small startups to industry-leading companies such as Uber, Shopify, and ByteDance. As part of this role, you will: Develop a highly available service for ML model serving. Enhance Ray Serve and our other libraries to simplify the development of next-generation ML applications in production. Improve our autoscaling capabilities to drive performance enhancements and cost savings. Optimize latency and throughput for both single- and multi-model serving scenarios. We'd love to hear from you if you have: A solid background in algorithms, data structures, and system design. Experience working with modern machine learning tooling, including PyTorch, TensorFlow, and JAX. At least 2+ year of relevant work experience. Bonus points! Experience in building and maintaining open-source projects. Experience in building and operating machine learning infrastructure in production. Experience in building highly available serving systems. Compensation At Anyscale, we take a market-based approach to compensation. We are data-driven, transparent, and consistent. The target salary for this role is $170,112 ~ $237,000. As the market data changes over time, the target salary for this role may be adjusted. This role is also eligible to participate in Anyscale's Equity and Benefits offerings, including the following: Stock Options Healthcare plans, with premiums covered by Anyscale at 99% 401k Retirement Plan Wellness stipend Education stipend Paid Parental Leave Flexible Time Off Commute reimbursement 100% of in office meals covered Anyscale Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are evaluated without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law. Anyscale Inc. is an E-Verify company and you may review the Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Right to Work posters in English and Spanish
summary: Anyscale is seeking talented engineers to join their Platform team and contribute to the development of next-generation, high-performance machine learning serving systems. The team focuses on building and maintaining the open-source Ray Serve library and contributing to the Anyscale platform. The role involves developing a highly available service for ML model serving, enhancing Ray Serve and other libraries, improving autoscaling capabilities, and optimizing latency and throughput for single- and multi-model serving scenarios.

title: AI Engineer, Internship
description: Join us at Cleric Cleric is an AI-powered agent designed to manage and resolve issues in production environments autonomously. It uses an LLM-based reasoning engine to react to, interpret, and implement solutions to production issues, even those it's encountering for the first time. We are building a future where engineers can concentrate on software development while Cleric takes care of the production environment. Our mission is to develop autonomous software that can manage, repair, and optimize itself—the holy grail. Now is a divine time to join. We're a small group of veterans in AI, software, and infrastructure, backed by a leading AI venture capital firm and Silicon Valley angels. About The Role We’re hiring an AI Engineering Intern to help agentify our team and to improve the performance of our AI agent, Cleric. In this role you will help to augment our team with agent-based frameworks to increase our ability to faster and to make better decisions. Additionally, you will help us build a product that is robust, reliable, and always improving. You will integrate the latest AI techniques to build a product that can respond quickly to incidents, reason with high reliability, provide accurate resolutions, and learn from its experiences. Ideally, these qualities describe you You have a solid foundation in software engineering and are comfortable with Python, TypeScript, and Go. You love building with generative AI and have a track record of shipping projects. You may have a background in ML, or maybe you’re self taught. You understand how to build an evaluation system for agent based systems. Everything from modeling the problem, collecting evaluation data, and optimizing the agent. You know how to leverage the latest tools in building generative AI products, including evaluation, retrieval, vector search, knowledge graphs, and evaluations. You have a strong grasp of prompt engineering. You can effectively interact with language models to elicit desired responses or behaviors. You have experience in integrating, tuning, or training foundation models. Examples of what you’ll do As an AI Engineer Intern, you will work closely with the product team to enhance the performance and accuracy of our LLM-based reasoning engine, memory module, evaluation stack, and simulation environment. You will apply the latest AI developments to both our team and our product, ensuring that Cleric remains a best-in-class SRE teammate. You will help us iterate towards product-market fit in an early-stage, open-ended environment. Embody our end users (engineers with operational responsibilities), immersing yourself in their needs, pains, and aspirations. How we work Small teams, big impact: We believe that small teams can deliver great products. Culture matters: We value a positive and inclusive work environment. In-person collaboration: We believe in working closely to deliver the best results. AI-first approach: We don't simply build AI products; we augment ourselves with it. Interview process First contact: A quick chat with one of the founders. Take-home assignment: You’ll work on a small take home project that leverages generative AI. System design session: We will work through a system design problem with you. This will be related to the work you do daily. Culture fit discussion: We'll talk about your background, your motivations, and our team culture. Food: Grab lunch or dinner with us!
summary: Cleric is seeking an AI Engineering Intern to help improve the performance of its AI agent, which autonomously manages and resolves production issues.  The intern will work on agent-based frameworks, build a robust and reliable product, and integrate the latest AI techniques for quick incident response, reliable reasoning, and accurate resolutions. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in software engineering, experience with generative AI, and knowledge of agent-based systems evaluation.

More can be found about us here: https://greylock.com/ About the Greylock Recruiting Team: As full-time, salaried employees of Greylock, we provide free candidate referrals/introductions to active and upcoming investments to help them grow/succeed (as one of the many services we provide). Our recruiting team, combined, has over 125 years of in-house recruiting experience at successful startups through FAANG’s and over 30 years of VC Talent.

title: AI/ML Engineer (US)
description: Who are we? Whatfix is a data-driven digital adoption platform (DAP) that enables organizations and users to maximize the benefits of software. Whatfix acts as an interactive overlay on top of any application to guide users with real-time guidance, self-help support, and user feedback. With product analytics and AI, Whatfix enables scalable success with technology, maximizing productivity, and leveraging data-driven insights for better decision-making. The company has seven offices globally in the US, India, UK, Germany, Singapore, and Australia, and works with Fortune 500 companies around the world. Whatfix has raised $140 million to date and is backed by marquee investors including Softbank, Sequoia, Dragoneer, and Cisco Investments. “Hustle Mode ON” is the motto we live by. About the Role: Whatfix is working on building bots/assistant that can take instructions by users in Natural language (e.g. "Apply for Casual leave from 20th Aug to 25th Aug 2023”) and the bot will control the browser and execute the task on any application on the web. We are looking for rockstar AI/ML Engineers who have worked on UIs and AI/ML. Research & Implement ML and Deep learning algorithms for production Build infrastructure needed for AI/ML systems, such as model inference, automated (re-)training, monitoring, explainability, etc. understand the potential and limitations of AI for your Products Run necessary ML tests and benchmarks for model validation Fine-tune, retrain, and scale existing model deployments Articulate complex problems by communicating viable architecture and design approaches in a clear and concise manner Implement computationally complex model training and software applications understanding Neural networks and integrate them into the Whatfix SaaS platform Design and develop highly scalable, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems for one of the world’s fastest-growing startups Envision project goals, and product architectural solutions with a high focus on detail to ensure successful implementation Occasionally participate in customer demos & provide inputs wherever required Conduct research to provide technical solutions at scale for real-world challenges in various scenarios Our ideal AI/ML Engineer: Experience and a strong analytical background, with a degree in computer science, engineering, machine learning, artificial intelligence, deep learning, algorithms, statistics, or a similar field desirable Direct work experience and proficiency in a few of the below technologies and frameworks: Solid experience in building systems with vision processing, deep neural networks, and reinforcement learning Solid understanding of working with Knowledge graphs for AI projects Strong understanding of concepts related to Machine Learning and Statistics Deep understanding of the family of CNN algorithms such as R-CNN, Fast R-CNN, Faster R-CNN, YOLO, etc. Hands-on programming skills in Python Solid hands-on knowledge of using Deep learning libraries such as PyTorch, Fastai, TensorFlow, OpenCV, etc. Proficiency in the implementation of algorithms and the use of advanced data structures to solve problems in computing. A solid foundation in the principles of computer science is desired. Working knowledge of finding ways to quickly experiment and deploy at least 2 DL-based solutions to production Excellent communication and technical skills A can-do attitude and entrepreneurial spirit to conceive ideas, turn challenges into opportunities, and build products Ability to collaborate effectively with highly technical resources in a fast-paced environment Ability to solve complex challenges/problems and rapidly deliver innovative solutions Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science Nice-to-haves: Hands-on experience with Front end technologies like - HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Publication of DL-based research work in top-tier conferences Previous experience with transformer/vision transformer-based models Understanding distributed computing using Spark What Sets Us Apart From The Rest Whatfix has been named among the top 20 B2B tech companies like Adobe, PayPal, and Cisco With YoY revenue growth of over 65%, we have also been recognized among the top 20 fastest-growing SaaS companies worldwide in the SaaS 1000 list Recognized by Forrester and Everest Group as a 'Leader' in the digital adoption space, and listed by LinkedIn among one of the Top 5 startups in India in 2020 Listed in Deloitte Technology Fast 500™ among fastest-growing companies in North America for 2022 and 2021 and recognized as a Great Place to Work 2022-2023 Our Customer centricity is evident from a Customer rating of 4.67 on G2 Crowd & 4.7 on Gartner Peer Insights Perks / Benefits Equity plan Mac shop, work with the newest technologies Unlimited PTO policy Paid maternity/paternity leave Monthly cell phone stipend Paid UberEats lunches daily Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage (Whatfix pays 80% of the premium for individuals and their families; for the HSA, Whatfix contributes $1,000 for individuals and $2,000 for a family) Team and company outings Learning and Development benefits This role requires working onsite at our San Jose office. To facilitate global collaboration, our US teams start and end early, while our India teams start and end late. US teams do not have any evening meetings. Relocation and Sponsorship offered. Whatfix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and E-Verify participant. All activities must be in compliance with our Equal Opportunity Laws, ADA, and other regulations, as appropriate. We value diversity at our company and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. description: LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters. Location: At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together. This is a full-time engineering role based in Sunnyvale, CA Team Overview: Foundational AI Technologies (FAIT) organization stands as the innovation epicenter, addressing the fundamental AI challenges and the force behind LinkedIn's next-generation AI-driven member experiences. Our mission spans across the entire marketplace, leveraging our expertise in data curation, algorithm development, and robust infrastructure to spearhead AI innovations.
